column4: can I install software on a user that does not have sudo privileges?
idk, i was reading a little http://brainstorm.ubuntu.com/idea/16475/
how with source when  I do make install it install normally?
when you do ./configure you add --prefix=$HOME/bin or somwhere else you have access, then make, make install will put it where the prefix was
compiling generally take longer then the time I they have on my system
i would look into chroot jail
huh? the point of chroot is that each user get's their own little world to play in
don't they need sudo to chroot?
i havn't used chroot like that, but i would imagine it would act exactly the same? i'm assuming their using xforwarding so there isn't a big difference betweena  cmd line prob and an x prog
I think it should work, it's what it was designed for. no they wouldn't be able to
i havn't used it tooo extensivly so i can't guide you much past here, but i know there are good tutorials on it
